titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Administrative Functions, RG 4
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Administrative Functions, RG 4 FA1798

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Administrative Functions, RG 4

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 4, Administrative Functions, is comprised of the records of the Finance, Human Resources and Communications areas. A complete chronicle of the Foundation's finances is contained in the federal tax returns (Form 990s). This record group holds tax returns for the years 1952 to 2018. Human Resources materials include Policy and Procedures Manuals, Benefits and Compensation Plans, and Strategic Planning files. The Communications files offer insights into the public perception of Knight Foundation, through its collection of news releases about Foundation activities, publications, special events, and biographical records of prominent figures in its history.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as follows:

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged first by subseries (Administrative Files, Benefits, Policies, Staffing, and Strategic Planning) then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files include documents on employee benefits, such as vision plans, 403(b) plans, long-term disability, retirement plans, and the matching gift program. Often several updated versions are included. Several versions of the Knight Foundation's Personnel and Policy Manuals (1983-2002), along with files on the candidate selection process also are included. In addition, information exists on new employee orientation (2003), staff streamlining (1998-1999) and strategic planning (1999).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials submitted to the IRS for determination of Knight Foundation's Employee Benefit Plan include: copy of proposed amendment and restatement along with executed copies of the prior plan document and all amendments thereto; copy of proposed 5th amendment required by the IRS as part of the still pending GUST submission; copy of employee notification regarding submission of the Plan to the IRS for a determination; completed form 5300 and all required attachments; copy of the plan's prior determination letter and all amendments and plan restatements; and form 2848. Also included are letters from the IRS acknowledging receipt of the request and providing a document locator number and, finally, a favorable determination of the plan. Also included is additional correspondence between the IRS and Mercer re: favorable determination of the retirement plan, dating 2008/2009 and a copy of a Board resolution (dated March 9. 2009) approving the retirement plan for employees of Knight Foundation. (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Knight Foundation Section 403(b) Plan, Amended and Restated as of June 1, 2008 includes definitions, participation, contributions, vesting, investment options, distributions, administration, and signatures and five amendments to the 403B plan. Also included is a memo from Mercer Associates re: 2008 Adjusted Funding Target Attainment Percentage (AFTAP) certification for the plan for 2008 and various amendments to the plan, dated 1996 - 2009. Also included is a memo from Terese Coudreaut re: participant fee disclosures. Cambridge Associates reviewed Vanguard's fees for the plan and reported the expense ration was well below industry average. Also Retirement Plan for Employees of The Knight Foundation, Amended and Restated as of January 1, 2008; signed December 10, 2012. A 2nd Amendment to the retirement plan for employees of KF, signed November 14, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Streamlining Committee was tasked with improving Knight Foundation operations to allow the staff to work more efficiently and to respond to its constituents in a more timely manner. The Committee identified six desired outcomes and formulated seven recommendations. Included are interim and final reports, an executive summary, memoranda, meeting agendas, proposals from consulting companies and staff evaluations, and process flow charts. Two folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook created when program launched in 1998 includes background, goals and objectives, and description; selection criteria; guidelines; and an implementation plan. Also included is a copy of the updated internship program description, guidelines and sample timesheet (2006) and miscellaneous program-related correspondence. Also included are names and bios of the 2014 and 2016 interns, a thank you note from intern Carolina Wilson and a photo of the interns with Alberto Ibarguen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: January 2017 Home Week agenda. Starting in 2017, all KF staff are required to gather quarterly to exchange information to leverage the range of expertise and ability across staff in service to support informed and engaged communities. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All-staff discussion and Working Session on diversity, equity and inclusion, facilitated by The Race Matters Institute (RMI) to embark on an effort to improve our ability to consider, discuss and reflect in our work real understanding of issues of diversity, equity and inclusion. In order to provide critical context and foregrounding to the session, three pre-reading were assigned, The Curb-Cut Effect, by Angela Glover Blackwell, A Gardener's Tale, by Camara Jones and The Case for Reparations by Ta-Nehisi Coates. Also included is the May Home Week Agenda.

Frank Lane recommended that KF's "core essence continue to be transformational leadership"; and that the Foundation be known as the Knight Brothers Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Included is a list of Web 3.0 Goals and Key Messages and Knight Foundation's Key Messages as they continue to tell the story of transformation; new website and branding launch in September 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Includes figures for budgeted and actual expenses. Also included is a disc of the Public Service Announcements aired on television in 9 languages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes memos on the new Knight e-newsletter; distribution of the 2008 Progress (annual) Report; announcement of the News Challenge Garage; periodic memos re: cool stuff going on at Knight; KF listing as one of "30 places we want to work" by Good Magazine; and Haitian earthquake recovery actions. Also included is a staff memo from Andrew Sherry with a reminder about email and social media policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Also included is a 2010 blog item on KF summer interns and copies of the blog, now called Knight Blog, beginning in June 2014. The June 10, 2015 Knight Blog features the Knight Green Line Challenge in St. Paul, MN.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Summary document provides highlights of the mission, programs, assets and grants of Knight Foundation. It is updated on a periodic basis. Also included is a fact sheet, entitled "Knight Foundation Talking Points for John Rogers, March 2011" lists KF assets, performance, and asset allocation and positioning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: KF message: "Knight Foundation promotes informed, engaged communities. Specifically, KF advances: innovative approaches...journalism excellence... and projects that lead to transformational, sustainable change." KF employees were urged to "remember to stay inside the message house." A revised version, issued in June, is marked "For internal use only" and divides the KF message into three parts: Journalism excellence, Community engagement and Artistic excellence. Also included is a concept paper entitled, "What does an informed, engaged community look like?"

did.unittitle: Mid-year Communications Report, January-June 2014 and January-June 2015

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report highlighting media coverage for KF for the first half of 2014. Press mentions increased 18% year-on-year and KF's impact score was 2nd among 16 comparable foundations. Also, report highlighting media coverage for KF for the first half of 2015. Press mentions increased 66% from previous year and KF's media impact score increased 65% from the previous year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report, prepared by Octopus Creative, charted how people use the existing Knight Foundation website. The purpose of the report was to gain insight into what people are searching for, and accessing, as well as where they come from. It included data from June 2014 to June 2015. It will be used to help with the planned upgrade to the KF website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report highlighting media coverage for KF for the first half of 2015. Press mentions increased 66% from previous year and KF's media impact score increased 65% from the previous year.

physdesc.extent: 5 letter document boxes and 1 half document box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are files for Advisors, Officers, Trustees and some staff members. The files contain biographical descriptions and news clippings. Creed Black's files include news releases and clippings, biographical sketches, tributes and awards, and information on his retirement party. The files on John S. and James L. Knight contain letters, magazine articles, and tributes and memorials. There is one file on the wedding of John S. Knight, Jr. The files for John S. Knight (1894-1981) include his biography by Charles Whited, Knight: A Publisher in the Tumultuous Century (New York: E.P. Dutton, 1988.) The Knight Foundation commissioned the book after John S. Knight's death in 1981. It details his life as a young journalist, publisher, and owner of a newspaper empire. Knight Foundation holds the copyright for this publication. SEE Record Group 3, Correspondence and Subject Files, Lee Hills, "Knight, John S. - Book on," for documents concerning the commissioning of this work. Also SEE, Record Group 8, Printed Materials, Reference, for reviews of Charles Whited's biography of John S. Knight, as well as clippings about John S. Knight's death in1981, and the bequest from his estate to Knight Foundation, 1981-1982.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographies of Community Advisors: Reid Ashe, Roger Coover, Carrol Dadisman, John Dotson, Virginia Dodge Fielder, William Friday, James Gels, Robert Hall, Christopher Harte, Theodore Hesburgh, Harold Higgins, Lloyd Huck, Mary Junck, David Lawrence, Michael Maidenberg, Frank McComas, Scott McGehee, Heath Meriwether, James Moss, Frederick Mott, Rolfe Neill, Edmund Olson, Burl Osborne, Lewis Owens, J. Michael Pate, Dorothy Ridings, Peter Ridder, Gene Roberts, Richard Sadowski, Gerald Turner, Richard Wald, Billy Watson, Craig Wells, Roland Weeks, Clement Winke. Also includes an article on Rod Petrey, KF outside counsel and obituary of Tom Hearn, Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics chair. Included is an obituary of William Friday, former chair of the KCIA, with quotes from Alberto Ibarguen and co-chairs Brit Kirwan and Gerald Turner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between J. Barnett Woodruff and Larry Meyer re: Woodruff's friendship with John S. Knight, Jr. Woodruff attended prep school with Knight, introduced Knight to his future wife, and served as an usher at his wedding. Also enclosed are two newspaper articles which provide details on the wedding party and guests, and copies of pictures of Knight and Woodruff as boxers at Culver. Also included is a copy of an editorial written by JS Knight on the death of his son; excerpt of an after-action report on the war activities of Knight that led up to his death; notice of award of a Bronze star medal to Knight; and note of thanks by John S. Knight.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of obituaries for Charles Landon Knight II. Known as Landon, he was born in 1924, the second son of John S. Knight. He died in Akron, Ohio on March 4, 2000. He was survived by his wife, Cynthia, and his daughter, Rebecca.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News clippings and articles on Alberto Ibarguen, KF president. Includes a 1998 Miami Today article re: Alberto names as Miami Herald publisher and a 2004 cover story by Editor & Publisher, "Alberto Ibarguen sparked the trend in Miami, and now mainstream papers big and small stake a claim in the Latino market"; a Miami Herald story on his resignation and several articles about speeches Ibarguen made to KF constituencies. Also included is an invitation and program for a speech in Anniston, Alabama and a program for the BOT/community dinner in Detroit on September 11, 2006 (which also featured Dr. Austen); an article entitled "Knight New Media Center makes its debut at ASNE", which also mentions Eric Newton; and a news release which names Ibarguen as one of the advisors to the Peter Jennings Project of the National Constitution Center; an interview with the Philanthropy News Digest re: Hurricane Katrina rebuilding and an interview with Hispanic Enterprise, "Looking Forward: Alberto Ibarguen wants to Memorialize the Journalistic Accomplishments of the past, but he's even more concerned about the future". Also included is a program for the dedication of the Newseum in Washington, DC. Alberto serves as chairman of the board of trustees and presented remarks at the ceremony. Also included is the program for the Silver Knight Awards, sponsored by The Miami Herald and the Knight Foundation. Alberto made remarks at the Alumni Luncheon held May 20, 2008 and an article in the University of Pennsylvania's The Pennsylvania Gazette, "The Newsman Behind the Newseum" re: Alberto's role as chair of the Newseum Board. Also included is a booklet from the PODER Philanthropy Forum which features photographs of Alberto, who participated in the forum in March 2008, along with a PODER magazine article from March 2008 re: "Rethink the power of giving"; an article from "One", the magazine of the Silicon Valley Community Foundation re: Seeding innovative thinking to meet the information needs of our communities; an article from Town & Country magazine re: "Miami Heat: city sizzles as its cultural dreams become realities" which quotes Alberto on Miami's art scene; an article in the South Florida Times re: Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial fundraising dinner sponsored by KF; and a June 2009 article in Forbes magazine, entitled "Can This Man Save the News Business?". This is a Q&A with Alberto re: KF's journalism grants aimed at "saving" the news business. Also included is an article, with picture, in The Chronicle of Philanthropy, July 23, 2009 re: "Knight of the Newsroom: Grant maker seeks to shake up journalism and philanthropy"; a tribute to Ruth Shack of the Dade Community Foundation by Alberto (Fall 2009); note and copy of picture of Alberto with Dean Singleton and Genachowski at FOCAS 2010; news release announcing Alberto's election to AOL's board of directors; photo and mention in Chronicle of Philanthropy newspaper re: "Inside the Searches for Filling Philanthropy's Biggest Jobs"; Alberto named "Top 50: 2011 - Power and Influence" by The Non-Profit Times, includes photo and write-up; "Investing in the Future of News" by Alberto for the book, Page One: Inside the New York Times and the Future of Journalism: A Participant Media Guide, provides background on the Foundation and highlights the work of the Knight Commission on the Information Needs of Communities in a Democracy and MIT's Media Lab; a cover story in the Miami Herald re: Most Wanted: Major Donors features a quote and photo of Alberto (partial story only); Alberto's picture was featured in a Miami Herald article of South Florida Catholic pilgrimage to Cuba during the papal visit; oped article by Alberto that appeared in the Biloxi Sun Herald re: Alberto's experiences during Hurricane Katrina; program for the "Lincoln, Miami, and the American Dream" program. Alberto was on a panel for a Town Hall discussion; issued a statement regretting paying a $20,000 speaker fee to plagarist and disgraced journalist, Jonah Lehrer; Alberto is on the cover of "South Florida Executive Magazine" - the inside story features photos and quotes from Carol Coletta, Matt Haggman and Dennis Scholl and is about KF's support in transforming Miami into a technology/entrepreneurship hub. Alberto is featured in Diario Las Americas anniversary publication (KF had a full-page ad); and is featured in a Chronicle of Philanthropy supplement on Endowments re: diversity in hiring of money managers; email notice and press release about Alberto's election to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and reaction from KF trustees. A Miami Herald Story about a Knight project aim to restore public trust with news media, quotes Alberto on the loss of trust on the media and how to restore it by. A Washington Post story quotes Alberto on the Knight Foundation and Columbia University effort to help shape First Amendment law in the digital age. Included is a program from the 2014 John W. Gardner Leadership Awards Luncheon where Ibarguen was honored as its 2014 recipient. An Inside Philanthropy article on The Futurist: Alberto Ibarguen and the remaking of the Knight Foundation. Business Monday article on the winners of South Florida Visionary Awards, Alberto was one of the winners "305 Award". Election of Mr. Ibarguen to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. Mr. Ibarguen was quoted at the Perez Art Museum third annual Ambassadors event, commenting on the new Museum's Director, Franklin Sirmans, first African American to serve as director of the PAMM or its predecessor, the Miami Art Museum. Chapman Awards honor impact on downtown. Mr. Ibarguen was quoted, "We've arrived at the beginning all over again", as he introduced the inaugural Alvah H. Chapman Award of Excellence honoring significant contribution to the development of Miami's original-and renewed-downtown center. (3 folders)

Also included is a Charlotte Observe news article, "Dinwiddie, Patterson are Women of the Year" in Charlotte.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Releases noting Dr. Austen's election to Vice-Chair and later Chairman of the Board of Trustees (succeeding Lee Hills). Dr. Austen has served on the KF Board since 1987 and was elected vice chairman in 1991. Also included is an Akron Beacon Journal article, published June 15, 2000 re: Austen's family ties to Akron and his work with the Knight Foundation; a curriculum vitae and biographical sketch; several articles on Austen's career; and several items commemorating his service to the Knight Foundation, including several brochures distributed at a dinner in his honor, the program for the dinner and an editorial in the Akron Beacon Journal applauding the naming of the Austen BioInnovation Institute and the program from the Board of Trustees dinner honoring Austen on his retirement.

Also included are two press clippings on Briggs' chairing of the Fund for Our Economic Future in Northeast Ohio and news item re: Briggs' receiving the 2009 Sir Thomas More Award from the Catholic Diocese and St. Bernard Church in Akron, OH. Also included is a Wall Street Journal article featuring Briggs and his wife, Alyssa Lenhoff, who recently moved into a downtown Cleveland condo. The article concerns the revitalization of the city.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Obituary from The Miami Herald for former KF treasurer and trustee, Charles E. Clark (trustee 1969-1991). Mr. Clark died in Miami on September 5, 2006.

scopecontent.p: News release announcing William Considine's election to the BOT, Knight Foundation; blog post re: Considine receiving the Polsky Humanitarian Award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Release noting Dr. Conway's election as a Knight Foundation trustee; biographical sketches; curriculum vitae; a Lear's magazine interview; news release re: appointment to the board of The Enterprise Foundation; several articles re: book reviews; announcement of death of husband, John Conway; and website profile on the ExxonMobil Masterpiece Theatre presentation of "The Road from Coorain", a dramatization of Conway's memoir. Also included is a program, certificate of commendation, and remarks by Jerry Austen in celebration of Conway's retirement from the KF board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Release noting Ms. Crane election to the Board of Trustees. Ms. Crane is the daughter of James L. Knight. Also included is a resume and Miami Herald article on her election. Ms. Crane announced her retirement from the KF board, effective with the March 2014 meeting. She wrote an article for Chronicle of Philanthropy re: John S. and James L. Knight and her own giving to Queens University in Charlotte, NC, where she resides. Also included is Knight family genealogical information, some going back many generations and memo and pictures re: dedication of Knight-Crane Hall, home of the James L. Knight School of Communications at Queens University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Information on Jim Crutchfield, former Akron Beacon Journal publisher, contains the press release of his election to the KF BOT, a Q & A interview re: his appointment to the ABJ and biographical information. Also included is a biographical sketch and a photo of his retirement dinner, where he was joined by Belinda Lawrence, Eric Newton, Terese Coudreaut, and George Martinez.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release announcing Paul Grogan's election to the KF Board of Trustees in 2000. Also includes biographical sketches and news articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical materials on Jay T. Harris, who joined the Knight Foundation Journalism Advisory Committee in 1989 and served as its chairman for two years before joining the Board as the designated Knight-Ridder publisher in 1994. He served for five years. Materials include comments by W. Gerald Austen in tribute for Harris' service, biographical sketches, a resume, several news releases, and a clipping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notices re: Gordon Heffern's election to chairman and chief executive officer of the Cleveland-based Society Corp., 1983; two biographical sketches, 1992, 1999; obituaries on the death of his wife, Neva; articles on his presidency of the Akron Community Foundation; and a resolution and remarks delivered by Gerald Austen at Gordon's retirement dinner, March 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Profiles, articles and clippings, and press releases describing Lee Hills career as a trustee, vice chairman and chairman of Knight Foundation, 1960-1998. Includes recollections of Lee Hills by Janet Reno (4/14/1994, ASNE convention); "comments regarding Lee Hills" by Jerry Austen at a Knight Foundation dinner honoring Lee at his retirement as Foundation chairman in 1996; and a profile by Alf Pratte. Two files relate to Mr. Hills's death (on 2/3/2000) and funeral. Another file contains background on the University of Missouri-Coulmbia School of Journalism's Lee Hills Hall (funded in part by a KF challenge grant as a way to honor Mr. Hills) and the Lee Hills Chair in Free-Press Studies, and the "Tina Hills Award for Service to the Community." (six folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transcription of a taped interview with Lee Hills and Tina Hills by Michael Clapp, University of Missouri Journalism School for the CD-rom in connection with the dedication of Lee Hills Hall, Columbia, Missouri. The interview touches on Hills' childhood and education, his love of journalism, his career, his marriage and partnership with Tina Hills, the Knight brothers, and the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release announcing Chris Hughes' election to the BOT, Knight Foundation. Included is a biographical sketch. Also included are two copies of Fast Company magazine, April 2009, featuring Chris Hughes on the cover and the story about his involvement with the Obama Campaign entitled, "The Kid who made Obama President". Also included is a story from the KF website: "Knight trustee Chris Hughes, new Publisher of The New Republic." Also included is an opinion piece by Dana Milbank appearing in the Washington Post, "The New Republic is dead, thanks to its owner, Chris Hughes" which is critical of Hughes' handling of the venerable magazine and a Wall Street Journal story, "Power Couple Lists Their Soho Condo" about Hughes' Manhattan apartment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release announcing Joi Ito's election to the BOT, Knight Foundation. Also included is a photo of Ito and Alberto Ibarguen at Joe's Stone Crab for Rolfe Neill's retirement party. Also included is correspondence between Ito and Ibarguen re: Ito's interest in KF and an article on Ito and biographical information and a memo from Alberto to staff and trustees re: MIT disobedience award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical sketch, article and news release re: Knight Foundation trustee, 1992- 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical file of Tom Johnson, CNN Chairman and CEO and KF trustee from 1991-1999. Includes several biographical sketches, curriculum vitae, news release, and letters upon his resignation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes memos re: James L. Knight's medical condition, death and funeral; letters of condolence; program for funeral service, with copies of remarks by Lee Hills and Knight's daughters; program for dedication ceremonies for the James L. Knight Physics Building at the University of Miami; biographical sketch; and a tribute to Knight in the Knight-Ridder 1st Quarter Report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles are on the death of James L. Knight, his life and times, his funeral, and the terms of his will.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence re: biography of John S. Knight by Charles Whited. Includes contracts with the publisher and author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper articles principally concerned with the death of John S. Knight, 6/16/81. Included are articles on his life, the terms of his will and his bequeths, especially to the Knight Foundation, his funeral, and memorials to him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Charles Whited's biography of John S. Knight, "Knight: A Publisher in the Tumultuous Century," was published in 1988 by the E.P. Dutton Company. Kinght Foundation commissioned the book and holds the copyright. The book details the life of John S. Knight (1894-1981) in 405 pages. Hardcover. Two copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazine articles on John S. Knight, including Newsweek (1955), "Knight of the Press: The New Breed in a Tough Game"; Business Week (1970), "Why newspapers are making money again", The Ledger (1998), "Top 50 Most Important Floridians of the 20th Century", and Editor & Publisher (1999), "Most Influential Newspaper People of the 20th Century".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tributes and memorials on the life and death of John S. Knight. Includes the program for the Polsky Humanitarian Award, given to Knight in 1975; several copies of the funeral program; a memorial done by the Akron Regional Development Board; several copies of the program for the dedication of a memorial plaque by the Society of Professional Journalists on the Akron Beacon Journal building; the 1981 Annual Report for the Knight Foundation; and the text of a speech by Bob Giles at the ASNE Convention, April 5, 2001 re: "Leadership Moment: John S. Knight" in which he describes Knight's writing of "Editor's Notebook" and his response to the Vietnam War. Also included are remembrances/anecdotes of Ray Fisher, Miami Herald photographer, about his career at the newspaper. Jack and Jim Knight and Alvah Chapman are briefly mentioned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters, some with copies of newspaper articles attached, expressing sympathy on the death of John S. Knight. Most of the letters were addressed to C.C. Gibson. Also includes is a 1983 letter from the editor of the Miami Herald enclosing an article on the 20th anniversary of the dedication of the Herald building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release announcing Susan Kronick's election to the BOT, Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Also included is a biographical sketch of Maidenberg and a copy of a commencement address he delivered to the graduating class of Columbia Graduate School of Journalism, focusing on the flooding of Grand Forks, North Dakota.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release re: election of Christine Amer Mayer, president of the GAR foundation of Akron, as a trustee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Obituary of C. Blake McDowell, Sr., Knight Foundation founding trustee (1950-1977) and vice-president and former director, secretary and chief counsel for Knight newspaper group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Obituary of Kenneth L. Milburn, Knight Foundation trustee (1951-1968) and treasurer and former general manager of the Akron Beacon Journal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Also included is a description of her home, a Saarinen designed house in Grosse Pointe Farms, Michigan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News release on the appointment of Olson to the Knight Board of Trustees. Release has been edited. Included is an article on Olson and her contributions to The Children's Hospital of Georgia. Also includes a news article on Knight's husband, Ed Olson, publisher of the Macon Telegraph. And an article in "The Dell & Cannon", school publication of the Ransom Everglades School in Miami, where Olson, a 1968 graduate of the school, was the 2007 commencement speaker. Also included is a newsletter for Goodwill Industries of Middle Georgia ("Goodwill Connections") featuring a story on the recently opened Knight Resource Center which features a picture of Beverly Olson (not detailed) at the dedication. Also included is a commemorative photo book, "Celebration of Support: University of Georgia" of photos taken at a reception to honor the University of Georgia's Most Loyal Supporters in February 2012. KF was a Celebration of Support 2012 Honoree. Beverly Olson and Beverly Blake attended the event.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

John Palfrey's article, "Building a Digital Public Library of America - the Digital Shift", which mentions Knight Foundation's $1 million grant. Also included is a KF news release announcing Palfrey's election as KF chair elect and a bio as Head of School for the Phillips Academy, Andover, MA, as well as a short email from John to the KF staff sharing his excitement on being elected board chair.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical file for Henry King Stanford, trustee from 1982 until 1997. File includes a biography, curriculum vitae, notes for Lee Hills on Henry King Standord, and news articles. Also included is an obituary for Dr. Stanford who died on January 1, 2009 at the age of 92.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical file for Paul E. Steiger, trustee. Consists of a NY Times article re: "Group Plans to Provide Investigative Journalism" in which it was announced that Steiger will head up a non-profit group called Pro Publica, which will provide investigative stories free of charge. Alberto Ibarguen is on the board. Also includes an annual report from the Wing Haven Foundation of Miami. KF was listed as a matching gift sponsor; Dia Steiger (wife of Paul) is Executive Director. Rolfe Neill is a patron.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Knight Center in Akron in 1994; Lee Hills Hall at the University of Missouri School of Journalism in 1995; "Meet Knight Foundation: A Conversation with Officers and Program Directors from Knight Foundation," (1993,1996,1998); Knight Foundation 50thAnniversary dinners (2000-2001).

did.unittitle: The American Journalist in the 21st Century: Key Findings - Informational Packet

This 2002 survey continued the series of major national studies of U.S. journalists begun in 1971. The book, based on the survey, is expected to be published summer 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Knight Arts Partnership is a $40 million commitment by KF to support arts in Miami-Dade and Broward counties. $20 million is for leadership gifts to the New World Symphony, Miami Art Museum and the Museum of Contemporary Aft. $20 million is for challenge grants to individuals or organizations whose ideas will help transform the community through the arts. Included is information on the challenge grants, FAQs, an application, and news releases announcing the new initiative. Also included is a Marketing and Public Relations Report, prepared by The Jeffrey Group, detailing the campaign to reach community arts groups and encourage submissions for arts grants.

Also included is a memo from Alberto Ibarguen outlining the new initiative, which strives to be a foundation-wide initiative through the News Challenge but also the Knight Community Information Challenge. Alberto appointed a coordinating committee (chaired by Lilly Weinberg and Damian Thorman) to coordinate both information and collaboration. Also included is a follow-up memo by Lilly about initiative progress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

This year's challenge represented an unprecedented collaboration between KF, Ford Foundation and Mozilla. The 2015 themes are Elections and Data. The Data challenge was a collaboration between Knight, Data & Society, and Open Society Foundations.

Card lists the project, a brief description and the award amount (5 copies). Also included are announcements of the 75 finalists for the 2014 South Florida Knight Arts Challenge, 88 for Detroit, and 69 for St. Paul.

The MLN is funded by the Knight Foundation and the Pew Charitable Trusts. 3 copies of 1999/2000 issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In 1994, the Knight Foundation launched a $1.7 million, two-year grant program to improve immunization rates for infants and toddlers in Knight Foundation communities nationwide. In 1996, additional two-year follow-up grants were also awarded. This report summarizes the structure and design, activities, outcomes and lessons learned from the initiative. A list of grantee organizations is enclosed. Soft-bound, ten pages, 3 copies.

did.unittitle: Listening and Learning: Community Indicator Profiles of Knight Foundation Communities and the Nation

The report represents a Knight Foundation effort to embark on a social indicators project designed to give visibility to factors effecting civic health in the 26 Knight communities. [3 copies]

did.unittitle: Building Capacity in Nonprofit Organizations edited by Carol De Vita and Cory Fleming

Penny McPhee provided the introduction to the volume.

did.unittitle: Museum as Catalyst for Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Beginning a Conversation

The meetings gathered innovative leaders from different disciplines to explore a number of interrelated issues, challenges and opportunities affecting collaboration and today's museums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

The American Teens series provides a special look at "What Works" in youth development in partnership with the Knight Foundation.

No. 1: Orchestra & Community: Bridging the Gap, February 2003 No. 2: Bridging the Gap: Orchestra & Classical Music Listeners, June 2003 No. 3: Bridging the Gap: Innovations to Save Our Orchestras, October 2003 No. 4: Initiators & Responders: A New Way to View Orchestra Audiences, July 2004 No. 5: Smart Concerts: Orchestras in the Age of Edutainment, December 2004 The pamphlets were designed to continue the discussion begun a decade ago with partners in the symphony orchestra field in Knight Foundation's Magic of Music initiative. KF engaged Network Impact to conduct a scan of the field of civic tech assessment and provide technical assistance to several grantees, March 15, 2015.

did.unittitle: Why Millenials don't vote for Mayor: Barriers and Motivators for local voting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Why Millennials don't vote for Mayor: Barriers and Motivators for local voting. Research report led by KF and Lake Research Partners aims to identify the causes of low millennial voter turnout in local elections and possible approaches for encouraging more informed local voting which brings more citizen voice to local government, June 4, 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chat The Vote. How Snapchat, Amazon and Facebook messenger Reimagined Civic Engagement in the 2016 Election.

did.unittitle: In Defense of the First Amendment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In Defense of the First Amendment: U.S. news leaders feel less able to confront issues in court in the digital age. KF, American Society of News Editors (ASNE), Associated Press Media Editors (APME) and Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press surveyed top editors nationwide to better understand how newspapers are responding to the changing economic and legal environment. They seek to answer if, in the digital age, leading newspapers were still taking on First Amendment challenges, April 21, 2016.

did.unittitle: Could it be sunny in Philadelphia?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Could it be sunny in Philadelphia? Philly's newspapers - the latest and the largest entrants into the world of nonprofit news - hope the move offers a fighting chance at long-term survival.This report is an examination of the arrangement in Philadelphia, and other flavors of non-profit affiliations by legacy newspapers, drawn from more than 30 interviews with key players involved in the transaction and other industry thought leaders, June 13, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Imagining the Future(s). Beginning in late 2015, Knight Foundation began a scenario planning process to imagine how the context around its central work supporting informed and engaged communities could change. We started by asking what the conditions might be for communities in 2026. This report includes three scenarios that attempt to position these areas of interest within the uncertainties of the broader world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: We're looking forward and back at the Internet as the Knight News Challenge turns 10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: We're looking forward and back at the Internet as the Knight News Challenge turns 10. In 2007 KF announced the winners of the first Knight News Challenge. In 10 years, Knight reviewed more than 10,000 News Challenge applications and provided more than $50 million in funding to 190 projects. On Nov 16, 2017 in New York, a dozen entrepreneurs, journalists and scholars were invited for an afternoon of dialogue of what we might expect over the next decade.

There are five versions of the report included.

did.unittitle: Free Expression on Campus: A survey of U.S. College Students and U.S. Adults

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Free Expression on Campus: A survey of U.S. College Students and U.S. Adults. Knight Foundation partnered with the Newseum Institute to support a nationally representative survey of U.S. college students. The study sought to better understand how U.S. college students interpret their First Amendment rights, their views of how to balance those rights against other considerations, the impact of their college environment on their views, and the ways in which social media and the press influence expression.

did.unittitle: Historically Black College and University Students views of free expression on campus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Historically Black College and University Students views of free expression on campus. did.unittitle: Future of the First Amendment: 2014 Survey of High School Students and Teachers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Future of the First Amendment: 2014 Survey of High School Students and Teachers. Survey prepared by The Stats Group. did.unittitle: Future of the First Amendment: 2016 Survey of High School Students and Teachers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Future of the First Amendment: 2016 Survey of High School Students and Teachers. The survey was conducted by Kenneth Dautrich of The Stats Group. The 2016 "Future of the First Amendment" study marks the sixth time since 2004 that Knight Foundation has surveyed high school students to understand their attitudes toward First Amendment issues.

did.unittitle: How Youth Navigate The News Landscape

scopecontent.p: How Youth Navigate The News Landscape: KF commissioned a series of focus groups with 52 teenagers and young adults from across the United States to learn more about how young people conceptualize and consume news in digital spaces-with a focus on understanding the growing influence of mobile devices, social media and messaging apps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forecasting Freedom of Information-Why it faces problems-and how experts say they could be solved. KF commissioned this study to better understand the landscape involving public access to government records by gathering information and insights from 336 freedom of information experts-journalists, advocates, records custodians, technology companies, scholars and others.

did.unittitle: Diversifying Investments: A Study of ownership Diversity in the Asset Management Industry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diversifying Investments: A Study of ownership Diversity in the Asset Management. KF commissioned this study to inform the larger discussion unfolding about diversity in the asset management industry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Understanding Snapchat: Media, Politics and the 2016 Election

scopecontent.p: Understanding Snapchat: Media, Politics and the 2016 Election. A survey of Snapchat Users.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a report, prepared by Bendixen & Amandi re: interviews with 793 community leaders from June to August 2012. Major findings include that Knight has achieved extremely high levels of name recognition in its eight resident communities and that significant proress has been made since 2009 on familiarity with the work of the foundation and awareness of the projects Knight is involved in. The survey done in 2009 is compared to the 2012 survey and is broken down by KF community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One copy of a report, excerpted for the Board, prepared by the Center for Effective Philanthropy. Key findings provide a summary of grantee responses. Also included are sections, with charts, on Methodology, Measures, Impact, and Relationships. Report is marked CONFIDENTIAL. Also included is a schedule and retreat planning materials for the January 2010 KF CEP Results Sessions staff retreat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes sections on highlights, market environment and performance evaluation for Knight Foundation, Fourth Quarter 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a series of charts, graphs and background information assembled by the Finance Department upon the announcement of the sale of Knight Ridder in March, 2006. Included are: a chart of KRI Stock Price vs. Assets and KRI Contributions to Asset Base; statements of assets and fund balance for the Knight Foundation by year; a brief history of the foundation; a history of Knight Ridder from its website; newsclippings and a press release; Knight Foundation historical record of assets and contributions; charts of assets to contributions, and assets vs. contributions; a list of contributions received, 1950-1965; Knight-Ridder year end stock price, 1973-2006 (February); a chart of KRI stock price; a list of KF assets and stock holdings; a chart of total assets vs. KRI investment; financial information re: John S. and James L. Knight estates; and KRI Stock Holdings Analysis. Some of the materials assembled were copied from other KF Archives sources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memo from Juan Martinez to Alberto Ibarguen re: the current value of Knight Foundation's corpus. The purpose of the review was to benchmark portfolio growth versus contributions in reviewing Knight Foundation contributions policy. As of the date, the KF corpus was $2 billion; its portfolio was $2.6 billion. Also included is back up information from Kevin Stephenson of Cambridge Associates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: A Review of Investment Program Governance Practices, Costs and Industry Trends

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Prepared by Hewitt ennisknupp (HEK) for the Knight Foundation, the report is an independent review of the governance model and costs related to the KF investment portfolio. The review also addressed alternatives to the current oversight model, trends within the industry and a discussion of practices of other institutional investors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Follow up memos chart progress and provide more detailed information on using the new system. Systems include Zendesk, used to manage requests and employee ACH.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Federal income tax return forms 990-A, 990-T and/or 990-PF for years 1952-2018. Information includes foundation assets, expenditures, listings of grants awarded, capital gains and losses on investments, and lists of investments. Also included is information on foundation officers. The returns for 2002 and 2003 include 990-PF and 990-T returns, as well as returns for the states of California, Florida, Virginia and Kentucky (2003). Also included are 1041 returns for the years 2007 and 2008 for the Knight Trust, of which KF is a secondary beneficiary. 2008 and 2009 returns are labeled, "Public Inspection Copy". Amended returns for the years 2004-2006, filed in 2010, are in box 20. Returns for years starting 2009 are short versions only. 2016 includes original and amended 990PFs.

Also included are 1041 returns for the years 2007 and 2008 for the Knight Trust, of which KF is a secondary beneficiary. 2008 and 2009 returns are labeled, "Public Inspection Copy". Amended returns for the years 2004-2006, filed in 2010, are in box 20. Returns for years starting 2009 are short versions only. 2016 includes original and amended 990PFs.

did.unittitle: Treasurer's Report to the Board of Trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Treasurer's reports to the board re: the financial condition of the Foundation. Includes information about independent auditors' reports, assets, portfolio performance, spending reports, stock holdings, etc. Reports are made on a quarterly basis, to coincide with board meetings. A condensed version of the treasurer's report is also available in board meeting minutes.

did.unittitle: Excess Business Holdings related to James L. Knight's Estate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two items: a memo from Tim Crowe to the Finance Committee and a confidential letter to Creed Black from Rod Petrey, legal counsel, both regarding excess business holdings of Knight-Ridder stock related to the bequest from the James L. Knight Estate.

did.unittitle: IRS Audit of Knight Foundation's 1991 return

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and documents relating to an IRS audit of the Foundation's 1991 tax return. The issues investigated included 501(c)(3) status of some of the grantees, withholding taxes for consultants and employees, and the Knight trusts.
